result.execSummary:
The defendant Brandon R. Aubert was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

from DOC re Completion of Challenge Incarceration Program

IT IS ORDERED that the Department of Corrections will Effectuate the change from Confinement to Extended Supervision determining the actual number of days served in Confinement and changing the remaining Confinement to Extended Supervision. The number of days will be determined by Department of Corrections Records Office staff and will be based upon actual release date. IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that the Warden/Superintendent of the institution to which the defendant is assigned shall effect the defendant's release within 6 working days upon receipt of this order.

records.addlTxt: For transcipt 12.2.15 sentencing hearing
December 2, 2015

Defendant Brandon R. Aubert in court in custody with attorney Thomas E. Johnson.  Scott H. Dirks appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court orders 1 year prison 2 years extended supervision. Sentence credit 0 days. Costs DOC collect. Eligible for prison programs, AODA and any treatment deemed necessary. Absolute sobriety, submit DNA and no weapons. DVIP and anger management. Comply with risk and needs assessment and any other screenign tools identified by DOC. Comply with case plan goals related to identifed criminogenic needs and follow thru with any programming recommended by DOC.
